tokens.resolved_gloss: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

tokens.resolved_gloss: Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
tokens.translation: Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
tokens.translation: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

tokens.resolved_gloss: to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
tokens.translation: to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)

tokens.resolved_gloss: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

tokens.resolved_gloss: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
